choose_credential_tip.message: Choose own credential fields for this page

register_pair_tip.message: FantasyKeep has not been configured. Press the connect button to register and pair with KeePassHttp.

disconnected_tip.message: FantasyKeep has been disconnected from KeePassHttp.

press_reconnect_tip.message: Press the reconnect button to establish a new connection.

connect_success_tip.message: FantasyKeep has been configured using the identifier "" and is successfully connected to KeePassHttp

old_version_tip.message: You use an old version of KeePassHttp.

select_login_info_tip.message: Select the login information you would like to get logged in with:

select_login_info_enter_tip.message: Select the login information you would like to get entered into the page:

more_password_right_click_tip.message: FantasyKeep found more than one password field on this page. To enter your logins, right-click on one of the password fields, and choose either the "Fill User + Pass" or "Fill Pass Only" command.

entry_changed_save_tip.message: Username or password changed! Save it?

credentials_will_save_tip.message: Credentials will be saved in connected database with identifier .

username_currently_not_save_tip.message: The used username is currently not saved!

credential_marked_bold_tip.message: The credentials with the used username are marked bold.

choose_credential_update_tip.message: Please choose the credentials you want to update:

fill_intro_tip.message:
If you just want to insert username + password into the fields where your focus is, press Ctrl + Shift + U.
If you only want to insert the password, just press Alt + Shift + P. You can customize these shortcuts on chrome://extensions/configureCommands page.

maxium_icon_blink_when_new_credentials.message:
What is the maximum time (ms) the icon should blink after detecting new credentials
Default: 7500

minimum_icon_blink_before_deactivating.message:
What is the minimum time (ms) the icon should blink before deactivating due to page redirects.
-1 to only use Blink Time ignoring Redirect Allowance (old behavior)
Default: -1, Recommended: 2000

num_page_cycle_after_redirect.message:
How many pages should the tab cycle through after the redirect offset before deactivating the icon
Default: 1

generate_icon_in_password_field_tip.message:
For all password-fields there will be an icon added to generate a new password.
It is generated by KeePass with the profile for automatically generated passwords for new entries.

retrieve_credentials_when_tab_active_tip.message: FantasyKeep will immediately retrieve the credentials when the tab is activated.

auto_fill_single_credential_entry_intro_.message: If FantasyKeep does only receive a single entry from KeePassHttp it automatically fills this credentials into the found credential fields.

active_autocomplete_username_intro.message: For all username fields on a page a dropdown list appears which contains all available credentials.

keepasshttpdd_needs_tip.message: FantasyKeep needs the plugin KeePassHttp to retrieve credentials from and send them to KeePass.

download_lastest_keepasshttp_tip.message: You can download the latest stable version from here:

autofill_http_auth_and_send.message: Auto fill HTTP Auth dialogs and send them.

autofill_http_auth_and_send_intro.message:
If credentials are found for a page and the login-type is an HTTP Auth request, FantasyKeep tries to login with the first given credentials.
An HTTP Auth dialog looks like this:

change_only_if_know.message: Attention! Please change the following settings only if you know what you are doing!

dangerous_settings_intro.message:
FantasyKeep communicates on http://[hostname]:[port] with KeePassHTTP.
If you want to run KeePass on a remote computer, you have to change the hostname.
Sometimes the default port is still in use and you have to change the port number in KeePassHTTP to get it running. So you have to set the same port number in FantasyKeep and KeePassHTTP.

port_intro_tip.message:
Change the port if you have trouble with running KeePassHTTP on the default port.
You have to set the same port number in KeePassHTTP options!
Default: 19455

respect_maxlength_intro.message:
Limit the field filled in to the maximum number of characters allowed by maxlength="" in the input as set by the website admin?
There is a possibility of this causing issues with sites that have decreased this value after you have already created one, or have increased it before the fact and the password stored in keepass itself is longer than maxlength.

connected_database_intro.message:
If you are using several KeePass databases you can define a specific icon-color to each of them.
This will help you to easily determine from which database the credentials are retrieved.

is_really_remove_identifier.message: Do you really want to remove the identifier from browser?

reconnect_any_time.message: You can reconnect your database at any time.

specified_credential_fields_intro.message:
If FantasyKeep detects the wrong credential fields, you are able to specify the correct fields by yourself.
Just go to the page and click on the FantasyKeep-Icon, now select Choose own credential fields for this page.
On this page you can manage theses specified credential fields.

is_really_remove_specified_credential_fi.message: Do you really want to remove the specified credential fields on the page ?
FantasyKeep will automatically detect the credential fields the next time you visit this page.

visit_chrome_store.message: Visit extension's page in Chrome Web store

fill_next_password_field_tip.message: also fill in the next password-field

supress_warnings_errors.message: also fill in the next password-field

disable_error_warnings_tip.message: Disables communicating errors and warnings via JavaScript alert.
